page.title: 17Strensham Water Works
page.content: Officialy opened on 29th April 1953, standing in approx 4 acres; the complex consists of offices, indoor plant, pre-treatment tanks and laboratory. There are detached houses for the superintendant and his deputy. On fields below the works there are 12 sludge ponds of approximately 3/4 acre each. From the intake at Upon the water is pumped through two 750 mm diameter raw water mains, approx 5.2 km to Strensham Water Works where it enters pre-treatment tanks. The two high lift pump houses take water from the contact tanks through a pipe bridge over the river Avon to Coventry Aqueduct on Bredon Hill. Treated water is pumped from Strensham into Avon Division via two 675mm, and one 900mm mains, with a number of bulk supplies enroute to feed Lower Seven Division and East Worcestershire waterworks Co.
